item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I am so interested in the books you are talking about, but it seems that the comment box did not capture the title of the books! Are you referring to the Graded Go Problems for Dan Players?
item.content:encoded: I am so interested in the books you are talking about, but it seems that the comment box did not capture the title of the books! Are you referring to the Graded Go Problems for Dan Players?

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: I noticed that you said you needed to "re-discipline my reading abilities". If you want a good way to get better at reading, then I recommend the first two volumes ofThe bother range from 5 kyu-3 dan, though most problems are rated as dan level problems. One goes over tesuji, the other life and death. I've done the tesuji one, and I think its a great way to improve your reading, especially since, in my case at least, I was able to apply a lot of the tesuji to my games faster than I thought I would. The life and death book has the same benefits, not to mention how the help you read faster and more accurately.
item.content:encoded: I noticed that you said you needed to “re-discipline my reading abilities”. If you want a good way to get better at reading, then I recommend the first two volumes ofThe bother range from 5 kyu-3 dan, though most problems are rated as dan level problems. One goes over tesuji, the other life and death. I’ve done the tesuji one, and I think its a great way to improve your reading, especially since, in my case at least, I was able to apply a lot of the tesuji to my games faster than I thought I would. The life and death book has the same benefits, not to mention how the help you read faster and more accurately.
